thread.section_title: Sports: Red Sox & MLB | Boston Herald
thread.title: Walkoff this way

author: Herald Staff
title: Walkoff this way
text:
Now that the League Championship Series are underway, it might warm your heart to recall that the Red Sox have played in 10 of the 47 American League Championship Series, a playoff round that began in 1969. Their all-time record in the ALCS is 5-5, and 26-31 in games played. Seven of those games have featured a walkoff hit. A Red Sox player has notched that joyous hit four times, all four coming since Aaron Boone ruined everyone’s night in Game 7 of the 2003 ALCS.
Here’s the list of walkoff hits in Red Sox ALCS games:
When Hitter, Team Pitcher, Team
1986, Game 4 Bobby Grich, Angels Calvin Schiraldi, Red Sox
•   Winning hit: RBI single, 11th inning, broke 3-3 tie
1999, Game 1 Bernie Williams, Yankees Rod Beck, Red Sox
•   Winning hit: Solo HR, 10th inning, broke 3-3 tie
2003, Game 7 Aaron Boone, Yankees Tim Wakefield, Red Sox
•   Winning hit: Solo HR, 11th inning, broke 5-5 tie
2004, Game 4 David Ortiz, Red Sox Paul Quantrill, Yankees
•    Winning hit: 2-run HR, 12th inning, broke 4-4 tie
2004, Game 5 David Ortiz, Red Sox Esteban Loaiza, Yankees
•    Winning hit: RBI single, 14th inning, broke 4-4 tie
2008, Game 5 J.D. Drew, Red Sox J.P. Howell, Rays
•    Winning hit: RBI single, 9th inning, broke 7-7 tie
2013, Game 2J.Saltalamacchia, Red Sox Rick Porcello, Tigers
•    Winning hit: RBI single, 9th inning, broke 5-5 tie
-COMPILED BY MICHAEL SILVERMAN/SOURCE: BASEBALL-REFERENCE.COM
